intro: Dampiera spicigera var. lanata, commonly known as the woolly dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or rocky areas. Its hairy foliage gives it a distinctive appearance and helps retain moisture. It is part of the family Boraginaceae, which includes other plants with similar structural and floral features.
